page.title: 05SECTION 3 Foot of Ullswater
page.content: are run during the summer months by the Ullswater Navigation Co. (Slide 2) LANDSCAPE + BUILDINGS -the area is rural, the hamlet of Soulby being a number of farms and houses, approx. l0 in all strung out along the hillside. TOURISM - Boating, sailing, swimming,canoeing, walking, fishing, caravan hire. TRANSPORT - junction of A.592 and B.320. There is a minor road from Dacre to Soulby. Passenger service from Pier to Howtown & Glenridding 3 times per day summer months only. LAND COVER - 01 - l7 houses & l caravan site ll - sheep & cattle l4 - Small area of Salmon's plantation used for rough grazing, large area of Dunmallet is deciduous, small section coniferous. Narrow area by lake and river grass & shrub covered.
